scenarioDescription:
The WASP-20 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-20 is a star with 1.2 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.39 times its radius. It is located 691.05 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WASP-20 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-20 system


WASP-20 b

WASP-20 b was discovered by the SuperWASP observatory, in 2015-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-20 b is 98.898 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-20 b is 16.388 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-20 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-20, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the SuperWASP.
name: WASP-20 - System With 1 Exoplanet
